alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 2:31PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Levels Likely Through This Week... Warm temperatures across the eastern Interior, combined with a much above normal snowpack over higher elevations, is causing a significant increase in snowmelt. Runoff into rivers south of the Brooks Range is causing water levels to rise and breakup to begin on many rivers. Local ice jams may form and result in elevated water levels. The increased runoff may also cause smaller rivers and streams to rise to bankfull levels or overbank in low lying areas. People along Interior rivers and streams should prepare for the possibility of high water levels this week due to ice breakup and snowmelt runoff. River access points and gravel bars will likely be covered with water along with increased debris in rivers. The latest breakup information is available at www.weather.gov/aprfc/breakupMap.
